page.title: 20TRANSPORT - RAILWAYS
page.content:
The railway through Alne is mainly used by passengers. It is a track for diesel locomotives but later it will be electrified. There are four lines, two to the North and two to the South, they connect the South of England to Scotland and pass through York.
The survey was carried out between 2 and 3pm for 5 days. On average we saw 4 inter-city express trains a day, 3 coal trains and 1 tanker train,most trains were travelling South. At one time there was a station in Alne and you could catch a train to Easingwold but now the site is used as a builders yard and parking for a haulage firm.
